intro: Ticoglossum krameri var. album, commonly known as the white orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a unique, intricate structure. It is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its aesthetic appeal.
